{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3462330,"name":"","username":"Soren_1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/soren_1/{size}/262420_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-21T21:56:08.373Z","cooked":"

Just posting here that I have designed some Swerve X2i covers as I haven’t seen any others yet. I haven’t been able to test it as I don’t have access to a 3d printer or X2i modules right now, but I will post an update when I can.
Onshape link

Swerve + Covers (1)3296×2547 1.01 MB

Swerve + Covers (2)3296×2547 1.04 MB

Covers (1)3296×2547 572 KB

Covers3296×2547 579 KB

The top cover is mounted using the two unused tapped encoder holes and two screws that screw into the motors. The bottom cover slips over the 3 spacers that connect the top plate to the bottom plate.
Swerve + Covers (3)2547×3296 1020 KB

Both parts can fit within the 180mmx180mm print area of an A1 mini
image751×595 62.1 KB

image684×575 41.6 KB

The top cover is also configurable to both encoder orientations.

I am open to feedback! if you have any recommendations, please post them.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-12-21T21:56:08.373Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":446,"reads":384,"readers_count":383,"score":2516.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":477182,"topic_slug":"swerve-x2i-cover-cad","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://cad.onshape.com/documents/a6f2e10d1f450da925f603ac/w/39463b38b4852d959cc571a5/e/2333d0da8e5d66fc864144c4?renderMode=0&uiState=676733e6ff8dd3079a655455","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Onshape","clicks":145},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/swerve-x2i-encoder-covers/493932","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Swerve X2i Encoder Covers","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":14}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61769,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Onshape enjoyer"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-x2i-cover-cad/477182/1","custom_user_title":"Onshape enjoyer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":14}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":14,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3467616,"name":"Vince Kaufhold","username":"VinceBuilds","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vincebuilds/{size}/231918_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-03T16:51:33.648Z","cooked":"

Printed one set of these out of HF TPU and it fit right into our modules! Everything seems snug so far but we can report back as we test more.

To anyone else who’s potentially going to run these, I’d highly recommend installing the bottom cover as you assemble instead of going back to install it after to save yourself some hassle.

Nice! I have made a few tweaks to the model over the past few weeks so I wonder which version you printed. Do you have some pictures?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-01-03T19:39:21.216Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":203,"readers_count":202,"score":45.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":477182,"topic_slug":"swerve-x2i-cover-cad","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":67678,"username":"VinceBuilds","name":"Vince Kaufhold","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vincebuilds/{size}/231918_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61769,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Onshape enjoyer"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-x2i-cover-cad/477182/3","custom_user_title":"Onshape enjoyer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3467865,"name":"","username":"Soren_1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/soren_1/{size}/262420_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-03T20:42:30.999Z","cooked":"

These are the updates I have made to the CAD. Most are minor cosmetic changes:

  1. The top plate has been thickened to sit flush with the encoder mount and now sits over the screws that don’t hold it down
comparison

Old:

Swerve + Covers (1)3296×2547 765 KB

New:
Swerve + Covers3296×2547 840 KB

  1. The dust lip on the back has been thinned and smoothed out to look nicer
comparison

Old:

Swerve + Covers (4)3296×2547 379 KB

New:
Swerve + Covers (3)3296×2547 374 KB

  1. The tube corners have been slimmed down to better accommodate top mounting
comparison

Old:

New:

There is still a tiny bit of clipping but nothing a freshman and a file can’t handle

  1. A couple of annoying lines have been smoothed out
comparison

Old:

Swerve + Covers (5)3296×2547 283 KB

New:
Swerve + Covers (7)3296×2547 287 KB

  1. Screw clearance holes have also been changed from close fit (0.196") to free fit (0.201") for easier assembly

New things:
I have added a dust cover for the bevel gear

Summary

Swerve + Covers (8)3296×2547 1.12 MB

Swerve + Covers (9)2547×3296 879 KB

It is fixed to the fork using 2 1/2" socket head screws, screwed into the (very handy) tapped holes in the forks
Swerve + Covers (10)1920×2485 161 KB

The dust covers (should) fit on both the bevel fork and the non-bevel fork if you like the symmetry

I added an “exposed edge” variant of the top plate that gives space for the top support plate

Summary

Swerve + Covers (11)3296×2547 1.22 MB

there is an annoying “ridge” on the edge of the cover because the edge it sits on by the motor is not actually inline with the edge of the pocketing it is trying to cover
image970×416 8.16 KB

image1061×501 23.4 KB

I will try to make it look nicer but this is how it is for now.

I still don’t have access to X2i modules so I haven’t been able to test fitment. If you make your own, please provide feedback if anything does not work!

Looks like the one I printed was the original version. I’ll get some photos next time I’m in the shop with it. We’ll definitely keep our eye on the updates as we get ready to print 4 final sets for the robot. Still waiting on the purple TPU to arrive for that though.

I’ve just realized that the screw for the bottom plate clips into the cover. It’s fixed now, but you’ll probably need to add a spacer to lower the screw or drill it out a bit

Here’s some photos of the original version on a module. I just printed the newest wheel cover so I’ll check that fit today and start running the other new covers this week and report back.

2025-01-05 17.12.501920×1446 129 KB

2025-01-05 17.12.481920×2550 224 KB

2025-01-05 17.12.441920×2550 275 KB

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-01-06T17:08:28.299Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":54.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":477182,"topic_slug":"swerve-x2i-cover-cad","display_username":"Vince Kaufhold","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67678,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor - 418 <- 931 <- 461 <- 418"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-x2i-cover-cad/477182/7","custom_user_title":"Mentor - 418 <- 931 <- 461 <- 418","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3472628,"name":"Vince Kaufhold","username":"VinceBuilds","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vincebuilds/{size}/231918_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-06T17:27:01.303Z","cooked":"

Just remembered one small tweak I’d like to request: On the bottom cover, could you please make the “whale tail” a little more linear to aid printing? I’m running these in HF TPU so they’re more shatter resistant but that tends to sag a little at the spot I circled in red.

image825×489 52.4 KB

Sorry that it took a bit, but I’ve updated the back loft as you’ve suggested.
Old:

{0FFDBD37-B34E-4ACB-9428-B4B2FB975903}938×555 64.2 KB

New:
image942×622 37.3 KB

Thanks for catching that!

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-01-07T21:18:08.657Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":93,"readers_count":92,"score":33.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":477182,"topic_slug":"swerve-x2i-cover-cad","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":67678,"username":"VinceBuilds","name":"Vince Kaufhold","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/vincebuilds/{size}/231918_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61769,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Onshape enjoyer"},"post_url":"/t/swerve-x2i-cover-cad/477182/9","custom_user_title":"Onshape enjoyer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3476412,"name":"","username":"Soren_1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/soren_1/{size}/262420_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-09T05:49:59.924Z","cooked":"

WIN_20250108_21_21_15_Pro1280×720 128 KB

(Disclaimer, the screws for the bevel covers are supposed to be socket head, not button head, but its what I had on hand)
After my team received our own X2i modules, I was able to test fitment of the swerve covers. The bevel covers fit very well. The bottom cover was a perfect fit and was handy for holding the 3 aluminum spacers when putting the top and bottom assemblies together. I had a few issues with screw head clearance for the top cover, but I think it is an issue with print quality and shrinkage, not the design itself. I did increase the clearance in the CAD nonetheless.
